title: The Dow Dropped 344 Points Because U.S. Manufacturing Slowed Again in September
text:
October Surprise. U.S. stocks closed with substantial losses on the first trading day of the fourth quarter. A survey of manufacturing purchasing managers showed a second month of shrinkage and the weakest result since 2009. Shares of online brokers dove on news that Charles Schwab (ticker: SCHW) is eliminating commissions on U.S. stocks and exchange-traded funds. China’s Communist Party marked the 70th anniversary of its rule with a massive military parade, while Hong Kong protests descended into widespread violence. In today’s After the Bell, we...

check on the latest U.S. factory data that indicated contraction...
description: U.S. stocks closed with substantial losses on the first trading day of the fourth quarter. A survey of manufacturing purchasing managers showed a second month of shrinkage and the weakest result since 2009.
